# Setup:

```{r setup, include=FALSE, cache=FALSE}

if (!require(pacman)) install.packages("pacman")

pkg_list <- c("tidyverse", "glue", "broom", "magrittr", "prettydoc", "DT", "reshape2", "plotly", "moments", "emmeans", "gtsummary", "lmtest", "table1", "rstatix", "lme4", "ggeffects", "conflicted", "forecast")

pacman::p_load(char = pkg_list) #update=TRUE
pacman::p_load_gh(c("rstudio/gt", "tidyverse/dplyr"))
#knitr::write_bib(c(.packages(), pkg_list), 'bib/packages.bib')

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.align="center",
  #fig.pos = "!H",
  #out.extra = "",
  #tidy = TRUE,
  warning = FALSE,
  echo = FALSE,
  message = FALSE,
  error=FALSE,
  cache = FALSE
)

options(scipen=999, digits=5)

tc <- 0
alpha <- 0.05
set.seed(42)

initial.data <- "../data/initial.csv"
```

# Data preparation:
***
***

```{r}
data.wide <- readr::read_csv(initial.data) %>% 
  dplyr::select(-X1) %>% 
  mutate(across(c(hotspot, mode), as.factor)) %T>% print
```

```{r results=FALSE}
### With reshape2
data.long <- data.wide %>% 
  reshape2::melt(measure.vars=c("P1", "P2", "P3", "P4"), variable.name = "subject", value.name="time") %>% 
  group_by(subject) %>% mutate(id = seq_along(hotspot), .before = hotspot) %>% ungroup() %T>% print
```
